metadata.title: CVE-2021-26937 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
encoding.c in GNU Screen through 4.8.0 allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (invalid write access and application crash) or possiblyhave unspecified other impact via a crafted UTF-8 character sequence.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-26937` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

screen - 4.8.0-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: screen package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-1ubuntu0.1').
